1result = lm(data = iris, Sepal.Width ~ Sepal.Length) 2summary(result) Call: lm(formula = Sepal.Width ~ Sepal.Length, data = iris) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -1.1095 -0.2454 -0.0167 0.2763 1.3338 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 3.41895 0.25356 13.48 <2e-16 *** Sepal.Length -0.06188 0.04297 -1.44 0.152 --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 0.4343 on 148 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.01382, Adjusted R-squared: 0.007159 F-statistic: 2.074 on 1 and 148 DF, p-value: 0.1519 1from sklearn.datasets import load_iris 2from sklearn import linear_model 3import pandas as pd 4 5iris = load_iris() 6df = pd.DataFrame(iris.data, columns = ['SepalLength', 'SepalWidth', 'PetalLength', 'PetalWidth']) 7 8df["Name"] = pd.Series(iris.target) 9 10model = linear_model.LinearRegression() 11ft = model.fit(df[["SepalLength"]], df[["SepalWidth"]]) 12print(f"Intercept: {ft.intercept_[0]:.6}, Coef: {ft.coef_[0][0]:.6}") Intercept: 3.41895, Coef: -0.0618848 ã‚¨ãƒ³ã‚¸ãƒ³ã«jupyterã‚’ä½¿ã†å ´åˆ Pythonã‚’ä½¿ã†ãªã‚‰ã€ãŠãã‚‰ãã“ã‚ŒãŒä¸€ç•ªæ˜å¿«ã§ãŠã™ã™ã‚ã®æ–¹æ³•ã«ãªã‚‹ã€‚
